a.style: font-family:"Playfair Display", Georgia, "Times New Roman", serif

text.tspan: Share of global CO₂ emissions vs. share of population, 2015
Each country's national carbon dioxide emissions (CO₂) emissions as a share of the global total versus its share of
the world population. CO₂ emissions are production-based national emissions and do not include emissions
embedded in trade (i.e. consumption-based). Countries which lie above the parity line have an emissions share
higher than their share of the global population.
Source: Based on Global Carbon Project (GCP) and UN Population (UNWPP, 2017)
